revised_title: Southern Ocean Environmental Changes and Their Impact on Marine Top Predators
tldr: This article discusses the effects of Southern Ocean environmental changes on seabird, seal, and whale populations in Antarctica. Human over-exploitation has caused significant changes in the distribution and abundance of these marine top predators. The authors evaluate hypotheses that suggest population increases in krill-eating penguins and seals are a result of recovery from exploitation, accelerated by the removal of krill-eating whales. The study highlights the importance of understanding the links between physical and biological processes and their impact on marine populations in the face of future environmental change.
